chapter.title: Common Tasks
chapter.para: Este capítulo contem informação sobre tarefas comuns

sect2.title: Reproduzindo e Extraindo CDs de Áudio
sect2.para: When you insert an audio CD, the Sound Juicer CD player and ripper opens automatically. To play the CD, click the Play button or press CtrlP. To play a particular track, double-click on the track or select the track and click Play.
To extract (rip) your audio CD, make sure the tracks that you want to rip are selected, then click the Extract button or press CtrlEnter.

note.para: If you are connected to the internet, Sound Juicer will retrieve the CD artist, title, and track data from MusicBrainz.org, a community-maintained database which contains data on over 360,000 albums.

sect2.para:
To start Sound Juicer manually, choose
Applications Sound & Video Sound Juicer CD Extractor .

You can use the preferences window to control where the extracted audio files are stored on your computer, the filename of extracted audio files, and the file format and codec used for the files. In the main window, choose
Edit Preferences .

Sound Juicer can extract audio files to the following formats:
Ogg Vorbis - Ogg Vorbis é um formato de compressão de áudio livre que tipicamente produz mais alta qualidade e uma maior compressão do que o MP3. Veja o Sítio Vorbis para mais informações.
FLAC - FLAC is the Free Lossless Audio Codec. It can compress audio files up to 50% without removing any information from the audio stream. For more information on this format, see the FLAC homepage on sourceforge.net.
WAV - Use the WAV format for voice recordings. Sound Juicer uses this format for low quality mono audio files.

You can also extract CD audio files to the proprietary non-free MP3 format. Instructions on how to rip to the MP3 format are in the help for Sound Juicer. Choose
Help Contents and navigate to the Preferences section.

sect2.title: Gravando CDs
sect2.para: When you put a blank CD in the drive Ubuntu will ask if you want to burn an audio or data CD. Clicking on Burn Audio CD will launch Serpentine . To add music to your audio CD, either drag music from your File Browser or use the Add button. You will also need to select the size of your CD (21, 74, 80 or 90 minutes). Serpentine will warn you if you exceed the set limit.

To make a photo or data CD, click the burn Burn Data CD. Ubuntu will open a CD/DVD Creator window. The CD Creator is built into the File Browser, and it allows you to add any file or folder you have permission to access. When you are ready to burn the CD, click Write to Disc. Ubuntu will then prompt you to select the drive containing the blank CD, and give you the opportunity to name the CD and select the write speed. Finally, click Write to create the new photo or data CD.

sect2.title: Reproduzindo e Organizando Arquivos de Música
sect2.para:
To play and organize your music, Ubuntu comes with Rhythmbox Music Player, which looks similar to iTunes. When you first start Rhythmbox, it will scan your home directory for any supported music files you have and add it to the database. To start Rhythmbox, choose
Applications Sound & Video Rhythmbox Music Player

Ubuntu does not directly support the MP3 format, because it is restricted by patents and proprietary rights. Instead Ubuntu supports the Ogg Vorbis format out of the box, a completely free, open and non-patented format. Ogg Vorbis files also sound better then MP3 files of the same file size and are supported by many popular music players (a list of players is here).

You can still play your old MP3 files by installing MP3 support (see ). Instructions for other formats, such as Windows Media Audio (wma/wmv) and other patent encumbered formats can be found on the Ubuntu Wiki.
The Cowbell ID3 tag editor can edit the metadata on your mp3 and other music files. To use Cowbell:

step.para: Install the cowbell package from the Universe repository (see );

To run Cowbell, choose
Applications Sound & Video Cowbell Music Organizer .

sect2.title: Usando seu Ipod
sect2.para: You can play music directly off your IPOD with Rhythmbox Music Player. Simply plug your IPOD into the computer, and open Rhythmbox.
To transfer music files to and from an IPOD, you can use the program gtkpod:

step.para: Install the gtkpod package from the Universe repository (see ).

To run gtkpod, choose
Applications Sound & Video gtkpod .

sect2.title: Editando Arquivos de Áudio
sect2.para: Audacity is free, open source software for recording and editing sounds. To use Audacity:

step.para: Install the audacity package from the Universe repository (see ).

To run Audacity, choose
Applications Sound & Video Audacity .
Para ajuda adicional sobre Audacity, consulte o programa de ajuda escolhendo AjudaÍndices.

sect1.title: Vídio
sect1.para:
To play video, Ubuntu comes with Totem Movie Player which looks and functions similar to Windows Media Player. Some features of Totem include custom playlists, DVD playback and more. You can start Totem by clicking:
Applications Sound & Video Movie Player
from the desktop menu system.
To read video files, Totem uses the Gstreamer framework. To play some video formats, you may need to add further codec support (see ).

There are also other multimedia applications available. Examples include Mplayer, Xine and Totem-xine (which uses the Xine framework, instead of the Gstreamer framework. Some users may benefit from trying alternative video players.

sect2.title: Reprodutor de DVD
sect2.para: The movie players provided in Ubuntu are capable of reading DVDs that are not encrypted. However, most commercial DVDs are encrypted with CSS (the Content Scrambling System) and currently for legal reasons it is not possible to include support for these DVDs in Ubuntu. However it is possible to enable support as follows:

warning.para: The legal status of this library is not fully clear. In some countries it is possible that the use of this library to play or copy DVDs is not permitted by law. Verify that you are within your rights in using it.

step.para: Install the libdvdread3 package (see ).

note.para: You will need to use Synaptic Package Manager to install this package

step.para: To activate DVD decryption, type the following line into a terminal prompt:sudo /usr/share/doc/libdvdread3/examples/install-css.sh
To play DVDs with Totem, you will need to install some extra codecs (see ).

However, the Gstreamer framework (used by Totem) does not support menus or subtitles for DVD playback. For this reason, you can install a separate DVD player, Xine, which supports these. To install Xine, install the gxine package from the Universe repository (see ).
Você pode abrir o gxine do menu Áudio & Vídeo.

sect2.title: Backing Up DVDs
sect2.para: Backing up your DVDs to files or onto DVD+/- discs can be done with DVD::RIP. To install DVD::RIP:

warning.para: Before backing up a DVD, you must ensure that you are legally permitted to make copies of it.

step.para: Instale os Codecs de Multimídia (veja ).
Enable DVD video playback (see ).
Instale o dvdrip e o transcode do repositório Multiverse (veja ).

Você pode rodar o programa usando o comando dvdrip (veja ). Se você desejar, você pode adicionar o programa dvdrip ao menu (veja ).Nós recomendamos você adicionar ele no menu Som & Vídeo, e que você use o arquivo /usr/share/perl5/Video/DVDRip/icon.xpm como ícone.
Para iniciar o dvd::rip, escolha AplicaçõesSom & Vídeodvd::rip.
Instale o pacote libstdc++5 (veja ).

note.para: You will need to use Synaptic Package Manager to install this package

step.para: Faça download do pacote Realplayer do link.
Instale o pacote que você fez o download (veja ).
Para executar o Real Player 10, escolha AplicaçõesSom & VídeoRealPlayer 10.

sect2.title: Edição de Vídeo
sect2.para: Kino é um avançado editor de vídeo. Ele tem excelentes recursos integrados com o IEEE-1394 para captura, controle VTR e gravação para a câmera. Ele captura vídeo para o disco nos formatos Raw DV e AVI, em ambos os tipo-1 DV e tipo-2 DV (audio separado) encodings. Para mais informação, veja página do Kino. Para usá-lo:

step.para: Instale o pacote kino (veja ).
Para executar o Kino, escolha AplicaçõesÁudio & VídeosKino Editor de Video .

sect2.para: You can also try the PiTiVi video editor by installing the pitivi package from the Universe repository (see ). PiTiVi is a video editor for the GNOME desktop. It is still in fairly early development, but worth a try.

sect1.title: Multimedia Codecs
sect1.para: Muitas aplicações no Ubuntu usam o framework multimídia de código aberto GStreamer. Os codecs para o GStreamer são organizados em diferentes pacotes dependendo da licença aplicada aos vários codecs. Você pode ver quais codecs contém em qual plugin na página do GStreamer.

Outras aplicações, como o Mplayer e o Xine, não usam o framework Gstreamer. Devido a restrições de patentes e copyrights, os codecs para estes programas não são totalemente incluídos no Ubuntu. Para mais informações sobre isso leia a página wiki Formatos Restritos.

sect2.title: Adicione Codecs ao Gstreamer
sect2.para: Para instalar codecs extras para o Gstreamer:

step.para: Instale os seguintes pacote dos repositórios Universe e Multiverse (veja ): gstreamer0.10-plugins-ugly gstreamer0.10-plugins-ugly-multiverse gstreamer0.10-plugins-bad gstreamer0.10-plugins-bad-multiverse gstreamer0.10-ffmpeg

note.para: Você precisará usar o Gerenciados de Pacotes Synaptic para instalar esses aplicativos

warning.para: Alguns desses pacotes podem não ser permitidos em alguns países: você deve verificar se você tem permissão para usar eles antes de instala-los.

sect2.title: Conectando à Internet
sect2.para: Para conectar à internet, faça o seguinte:

step.para: Se você possui um Modem ou conexão ADSL, leia primeiro.

Select the Connections tab. Select the Ethernet connection interface from the list, then click the Properties button. Ensure that the button marked Enable this connection is checked. From the Configuration drop-list select DHCP/Static IP address, then click OK.
Selecione a aba DNS e adicione ou apague Servidores DNS na lista Servidores DNS

sect2.para: Para ativar ou desativar conexões de rede, faça o seguinte:

step.para: Selecione Configurações de RedeConexõesConexão ethernetAtivar/Desativar
Para visualizar os computadores na rede, abra:
Você pode precisar digitar um nome de usuário, uma senha e um domínio. Você deve obter estas informações com o administrador de rede.
Uma lista de recursos de rede será indicada.

sect2.title: Email
sect2.para: The Evolution groupware suite can handle all your email, contact lists, tasks and calendar needs. It also can act as a newsreader and also integrates with the Gnome panel clock, giving you one-click access to your task list.
Evolution pode ser executado clicando em AplicaçõesInternetEvolution Mail do sistema de menu do desktop.
Alternativamente o cliente de email Mozilla Thunderbird está disponível. Para instalar este popular cliente de email, instale o pacote mozilla-thunderbird (veja ).
Para iniciar o Thunderbird, escolha AplicaçõesInternetCliente de Email Thunderbird do sistema de menu do desktop..

sect2.title: World Wide Web
sect2.para:
The powerful and secure Mozilla Firefox web browser is included in Ubuntu. Firefox features tabbed browsing, pop-up blocking, in-built search facilities, live bookmarks and more. Also supported are popular plug-ins such as Java, Macromedia Flash, and Real Player. Firefox can be launched by clicking
Applications Internet Firefox
from the desktop menu system.

sect3.title: Viewing Online Audio and Video in Firefox
sect3.para: In order to view online audio and video streams in Firefox, you may need to install some plugins. Which plugin you choose to install depends on the media player which you prefer (see ).

step.para: For the Totem Gstreamer plugin (the default Ubuntu media player), install the totem-gstreamer-firefox-plugin package from the Universe repository (see ).
Para o plugin Totem Xine, instale o pacote totem-xine-firefox-plugin do repositório Universe (veja ).
Para o plugin Mplayer, instale o pacote mozilla-mplayer do repositório Multiverse (veja ).
As alterações terão efeito quando você fechar e abrir o Firefox.

note.para: Esses passos instalarão o plugin para o Firefox. Entretanto, para tocar alguns formatos, você pode precisar adicionar alguns codecs extras (see ).

sect3.title: Macromedia Flash para o Firefox
sect3.para: Para visualizar gráficos em flash no browser Mozilla Firefox:

step.para: Instale o pacote flashplugin-nonfree do repositório Multiverse (veja ).
Para fazer o download e instalar o plugin, digite os seguintes comandos no terminal:sudo update-flashplugin
O plugin estará disponível na próxima vez que você iniciar o Firefox.

sect3.title: Plugin Java para o Mozilla Firefox
sect3.para: Some websites require the Java plugin for Mozilla Firefox. There are two ways of enabling support for this plugin. Most users will find that the easiest way is to install the j2re1.4-mozilla-plugin package from the Multiverse repository.
Alternatively, for a more complete Java installation, see .

sect3.title: NVU Web Authoring System
sect3.para: NVU is a WYSIWYG (What You See Is What You Get) graphical web design application, similar to Dreamweaver.

step.para: Install the nvu package from the Universe repository (see ).

To start Nvu, choose
Applications Office Nvu
from the desktop menu system.

sect3.title: Bluefish Web Development Studio
sect3.para: Bluefish is a powerful editor for web designers and programmers. Bluefish supports many programming and markup languages, and includes many utilities for designers and programmers.

step.para: Install the bluefish package from the Universe repository (see ).

To start Bluefish, choose
Applications Programming Bluefish Editor

sect3.title: Gaim
sect3.para:
Gaim is the default instant messenger client in Ubuntu. With Gaim you can talk to people who use AIM/ICQ, Gadu-Gadu, GroupWise, IRC, Jabber, MSN, Napster and Yahoo. The ability to use one client instead of several is a great benefit and allows you to have all of your buddies in one window so you can just click a name and talk. To start Gaim, choose
Applications Internet Gaim Internet Messenger
from the menu.

sect3.title: XChat-GNOME
sect3.para: XChat-GNOME is a advanced, graphical, multi-platform Internet Relay Chat (IRC) client. Its features include advanced scripting support (perl and python) and a clean, easy to use interface.

step.para: Instale o pacote xchat-gnome do repositório principal (veja ).
Para iniciar o XChat-GNOME, escolhaAplicaçõesInternetXchat-GNOME IRC Chat .

sect4.title: Entrando no #ubuntu-br com o XChat-Gnome
sect4.para: Uma excelente maneira de conseguir ajuda com o ubuntu ou se introduzir no IRC é entrar no canal official de suporte Ubuntu do brasil na rede Freenode.

step.para: Inicie o XChat-Gnome como acima.

When você iniciar o XChat-Gnome pela primeira vez, ele lhe pergutará seu apelido no IRC & seu nome real. Digite alguma coisa que você quiser em seu nick (Inicial do primeiro nome & seu ultimo nome, por exemplo, ou seja mais criativo), coloque seu nome real ou parte dele, e pressione OK.
Na Janela de Servidores que abrirá em seguida, selecione Ubuntu Servers, e clique em Connectar.

sect3.title: BitTorrent
sect3.para: A pontencialidade do BitTorrent é incluída por padrão no Ubuntu. Encontre um arquivo .torrent, clique nele no Firefox, e o cliente Gnome BitTorrent deve iniciar automaticamente.
Alternativamente, faça o download de um arquivo .torrent e clique duas vezes nele.

sect3.title: Cliente de Compartilhamento de Arquivos aMule

step.para: Instale o pacote amule do repositório Universe (veja ).
Para abrir o aMule,escolha AplicaçõesInternetaMule
Instale o pacote pan (veja ).
Para abrir o Leitor de Notícias Pan, escolha AplicaçõesInternetLeitor de Notícias Pan.
Instale o pacote liferea do repositório Universe (veja ).
Para o abrir o Leitor de Feed Liferea, escolha AplicaçõesInternetLiferea Feed Reader.

sect2.title: Introdução
sect2.para: Ubuntu comes with a comprehensive office suite installed - OpenOffice.org. The OpenOffice.org project is one of the most successful open source projects in the world, and provides a powerful wordprocessor, spreadsheet, presentation designer and database management, and provides support for most languages. The Suite has excellent compatibility with other major Office suites, such as Microsoft Office.
Para mais informações sobre o OpenOffice.org, veja a página do OpenOffice.org.
However, you may wish to add extra programs to your system. This section outlines a number of other useful office applications.

sect2.title: GNOME Office
sect2.para: The GNOME desktop features a separate office suite. These programs are generally lighter and faster than the programs in the OpenOffice.org suite, and have fewer features as a result. But this may be exactly what you want. The Suite has excellent compatibility with other major Office suites, such as Microsoft Office.
The GNOME Office Suite includes the following software:

listitem.para: Two graphics applications (Inkscape and The GIMP); and

note.para: Each of these applications can also be installed separately.

sect2.para: To install the GNOME Office suite:

step.para: Install the gnome-office package from the Universe repository (see ).

The Office applications can then be found in the menu at
Applications Office , and the Graphics applications can be found at
Applications Graphics .

sect2.title: GnuCash Accounting Application
sect2.para: GnuCash is a program to manage your personal or business finances. Designed to be easy to use, yet powerful and flexible, GnuCash allows you to track bank accounts, stocks, income and expenses. As quick and intuitive to use as a checkbook register, it is based on professional accounting principles to ensure balanced books and accurate reports.
To find out more about GnuCash, see the GnuCash website.
Para usar GnuCash:

step.para: Install the gnucash package from the Universe repository (see ).
You can open GnuCash by running the command gnucash (see ). If you wish, you can add a menu entry for the program gnucash (see ).

sect2.title: Scribus Desktop Publishing Application
sect2.para: Scribus is a professional desktop publishing program. For more information, see the Scribus website.

step.para: Install the scribus package (see ).
To install additional templates, install the scribus-template package from the Universe repository (see ).

note.para: You will need to use Synaptic Package Manager to install this package

step.para:
To start Scribus, choose
Applications Office Scribus
.

sect1.title: Graphics & Drawing
sect1.para: Ubuntu has some very powerful, world-class graphics and drawing applications available.

sect2.title: gThumb Image Viewer
sect2.para: gThumb is an advanced image viewer and browser. It has many useful features, such as filesystem browsing, slide show, image catalogs, web album creation, camera import, image CD burning, batch file operations and quick image editing features like transformation and color manipulation.

gThumb is included in Ubuntu by default. To start it, choose
Applications Graphics gThumb Image Viewer
.

gThumb's excellent help files are accessible from
Help Contents .
For more advanced photo & image editing, see The GIMP, below.

sect2.title: The GIMP (Gnu Image Manipulation Program)
sect2.para: O GIMP permite você a desenhar, pintar, editar imagens e muito mais! O GIMP inclui as funcionalidades e plugins de outros famosos editores e processadores de imagens.
O GIMP é instalado por padrão no Ubuntu, e pode ser iniciado escolhendoAplicaçõesGráficosEditor de Imagens GIMP .
Mais informações estão disponíveis na página do GIMP.

sect2.title: Editor de Vetores Gráficos Inkscape
sect2.para: O Inkscape é um editor poderosos para trabalhar com o formato SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics).

step.para: Instale o pacote inkscape (veja ).
Para iniciar o Inkscape escolha AplicaçõesGráficosInkscape SVG Vector Illustrator .

sect2.title: Modelador 3D Blender
sect2.para: O Blender é um suíte 3D integrado para modelagem, animação, renderização, pós-produção, criação interativa e reprodução.

step.para: Instale o pacote blender (veja ).
Para iniciar o Blender escolha AplicaçõesGráficosModelador 3d Blender.

sect1.title: Jogos
sect1.para: O Ubuntu vem por padrão com um certo número de jogos, incluindo Aisleriot Solitaire, Gnometris, e Mines.
Explore o menu de Jogos do Ubuntu em AplicaçõesJogos .

sect2.title: Frozen-Bubble
sect2.para: No Frozen-Bubble você tenta atirar bolhas em grupos da mesma cor para que elas caiam.

step.para: Instale o pacote frozen-bubble do repositório Universe (veja ).
Para iniciar o Frozen-Bubble, escolha AplicaçõesJogosFrozen-Bubble.

sect2.title: PlanetPenguin Racer
sect2.para: Race Tux, the Linux mascot, down a snow- and ice-covered mountain as quickly as possible, avoiding the trees and rocks that will slow you down.

note.para: Ensure you have hardware accelerated 3D drivers installed for your video card. For more information see .

step.para: Install the planetpenguin-racer package from the Universe repository (see ).

To start PlanetPenguin Racer, choose
Applications Games PlanetPenguin-Racer .

sect2.title: Scorched3D
sect2.para:
Scorched3D is a 3D remake of Scorched Earth, an artillery duel game.
Ensure you have hardware accelerated 3D drivers installed for your video card. For more information see .

step.para: Install the scorched3d package from the Universe repository (see ).
Para iniciar o Scorched3D, escolha AplicaçõessJogosscorched 3d.

sect2.title: Jogos do Windows
sect2.para: Muitos jogos que são disponíveis para o Windows podem ser rodados no Linux através de emuladores. Exemplo desses emuladores são o Wine e o Cedega

step.para: Para mais informações sobre o Wine, veja wiki do Ubuntu.
Para mais informações sobre o Cedega, veja wiki do Ubuntu.
Para poder compilar programas, alguns pacotes extras são necessários. Eles podem ser instalados todos de uma vez, como se segue:
Instale o pacote build-essential (veja ).

note.para: As instruções seguintes são apenas para computadores i386 and amd64. Para máquinas PowerPC, por favor olhe no Wiki do Ubuntu.
At the time of this writing J2SE is at version 5.0 Update 6. This is subject to change. If you do not see this version on Sun's website, download the newest version displayed.

step.para: Vá para http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/download.jsp e clique em Download JRE 5.0 Update 6. Não escolha o link com o pacote NetBeans.
Você deve primeiro aceitar a licensa, então clique em Linux self-extracting file e faça o download do jre-1_5_0_06-linux-i586.bin para seu disco rígido.

note.para: Se você usa um computador amd64, por favor substitua jre-1_5_0_06-linux-i586.bin por jre-1_5_0_06-linux-amd64.bin.

step.para: Instale o pacote java-package do repositório Multiverse (veja ).
Torne o arquivo, o qual você fez o download, executável. Na linha de comando, mude para o diretório onde está o arquivo, e digite chmod +x jre-1_5_0_06-linux-i586.bin
Para instalar o JRE, primeiro construa um pacote Ubuntu. Digite fakeroot make-jpkg jre-1_5_0_06-linux-i586.bin
Então instale o pacote que você construiu: sudo dpkg -i sun-j2re1.5_1.5.0+update06_i386.deb

To get your system to use Sun Java instead of the open-source (but less functional) GIJ that is installed by default, run: sudo update-alternatives --config java and pick the option that has j2re1.5-sun in it.

sect2.title: Development Tools
sect2.para: A list of handy open source development tools for use on Ubuntu such as Integrated Development Environments (IDEs) and powerful editors.

listitem.para: Anjuta é um Ambiente de Desenvolvimente Integrado (IDE) para C e C++.
Bazaar-NG is a decentralised version control system used for Ubuntu development.
Bluefish é um editor poderoso para web designers experientes e programadores.
Eclipse é um IDE para Java e outras linguagens de programação.
Eric is a fully featured Python and Ruby IDE.
Glade is a User Interface designer for building GNOME applications.
IDLE is the Python IDE built with the Tkinter GUI toolkit.
KDevelop é um IDE para KDE que suporta várias linguagens de programação.
MonoDevelop is an IDE for writing mono/.net applications in C# and other languages.
NetBeans is a Java IDE that features support for CVS and a form builder.

sect2.title: Programming Documentation
sect2.para: Some useful documentation for programming with Ubuntu.

sect3.title: Dive Into Python
sect3.para: Dive Into Python is a book on learning how to program in the preferred Ubuntu language, Python. Aimed at programmers with some previous experience, it comes installed with every Ubuntu installation.
You can read Dive Into Python here.

sect3.title: Tutorial PyGTK
sect3.para: PyGTK Tutorial is a tutorial on developing with the graphical toolkit often used for developing Ubuntu applications. It assumes that you have knowledge of Python but not necessarily GTK.

step.para: Install the python-gtk2-tutorial package (see ).

note.para: You will need to use Synaptic Package Manager to install this package

step.para: To access the documentation, visit python-gtk-tutorial.

sect3.title: Outra Documentação
sect3.para: Devhelp is an application to read and search all of the documentation that you install.

step.para: Install the devhelp package (see ).

Choose:
Applications Programming Devhelp
